II. Purpose of Addendum
The facility has completed construction of a new building Phase I to replace the
former building, which housed 112 residents male and female from 9-17 years of
age. Phase 1 of the new building will house up to 90 residents until Phase ll of the
new building is completed. Phase 1 will house 30 female and sixty males. Each unit
will have a total of ten residents.
This facility will continue to be a secure short term and treatment based facility for
female and male residents. There are no changes in the program design. New
policies and procedures has been developed and/is ongoing to meet the training
needs of the personnel and the operation of the facility.
III. Methodology
12/5/2000 – Request from licensee regarding building a new facility and architectural
plans.
02/24/2004 – Received final approval of electrical report from the City of Mount
Clemens.
03/15/2004 – Received application for building modification.
05/10/2004 – Received Fire Safety Compliance Report – “A” rating.
06/11/2004 – Received final approval of project from the Bureau of Construction
Codes & Fire Safety. Project #0739-02.
08/05/2004 – Received Certification of Occupancy from the City of Mount Clemens
#OF040005.
08/15/2004 – Received Environmental Health Report – “A” rating.
08/18/2004 – Request for a final onsite inspection.
08/24/2004 – Onsite inspection of the new construction site.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The new construction (Phase 1) has been completed to house 90 residents male
and female. The documentation required for the new construction has been
submitted and approved by the designated authorities. The Bureau of Construction
Codes and Fire Safety have given full approval to the facility. The Environmental
Health Inspector recommended an “A” rating. The facility has a Certificate of
Occupancy from the City of Mount Clemens. The Certificate was issued on
7/14/2004.
The licensing Consultant conducted an onsite Inspection on August 24, 2004. The
building is a single story facility with eight units. Each unit will house up to ten
residents. There is a long hallway on the left side of the building upon entry that has
numerous administrative offices. Each unit has two shower stalls and a bathroom
for the residents use outside of their bedrooms. Each resident bedroom is equipped
with it’s own lavatory facilities. The facility has a kitchen/dining room; medical unit,
2

classrooms, activity room, courtyard and the cafeteria/dining area will be utilized for
resident’s family visiting. The facility is handicapped accessible, as required by law.
The facility has staff work stations in the resident unit. The facility has adequate
office space. There are telephones in the facility and additional office equipment.
Based on approval from the Fire and Environmental Inspections, Certificate of
Occupancy, and an Onsite Inspection, it is concluded that the facility meets the Child
Caring Institution Licensing Rules related to new construction.
V. Recommendation
The newly constructed building is approved for occupancy. A second provisional
license is still in effect for this facility.
